data.title: Orange Grove
data.meta_description: Orange Grove empowers talented individuals to grow their vision into innovative ventures. We support aspiring and early-stage founders through horizontal and vertical entrepreneurship programmes, skills development and transfer of international know-how.
data.text:
Wessley M. Baker Aguilar has two surnames and blames his Spanish mother and Greek/English father. Born in Turkey but raised in Greece, you should never ask him where he’s from, as you’ll get a different answer every time. After working across various industries, from manufacturing to entertainment, Wessley finally realized his calling, Hospitality and Luxury Travel at Sea. Taking with him many years of experience in sales and business development, Wessley is now the Senior Charter Manager for Marvel Yachts Ltd. He is passionate about creating personalized yacht charter vacations and enjoys telling new clients why they can’t start their cruise in Athens, go to Mykonos, then Bodrum, make a “quick stop” in Kefalonia and return to Athens in seven days. In early 2016 and after a good charter season, Wessley got bored and a little depressed. As a result, he decided to start an online Digital Marketing course at the University of Illinois Urbana Campaign. He completed it successfully just as his first clients, for the new season, were about to board their plane to Greece. Wessley is highly skilled in cultivating strategic partnerships as well as client acquisitions with a high degree of retention. An out-of-the-box creative thinker, with his fair share of failures, Wessley is always eager to lend a helping hand.

Dr. Boretou is a Strategy & Transformation Advisor with more than 20 years of professional experience in creating value for the private and public sector through DESIGN THINKING, BUSINESS MODELS, ENTREPRENEURSHIP, και TRANSFORMATION (incl. Change Mgt). She has worked in leading roles for large multinational companies in the areas of ICT (Deutsche Telekom Group- OTE Group of Companies), CONSULTING (Ernst & Young, KPMG, Deloitte), the Athens 2004 OLYMPICS, the BANKING sector (Egnatia Bank), and the FOOD industry (PZ Cussons PLC-Minerva Edible Oils) managing significant projects. She has co-founded and assisted in the creation and development of several start-ups. She has also served as a lecturer for private colleges/ universities and for vocational training in the private and public sector. She is the owner of The S.T.O.I.C. HUB where she currently works as a freelance Strategy & Transformation Advisor. She has also launched Floorplan Advisor, where home owners and real estate agents can get practical, useable and low-priced floorplan remakes. Dr. Boretou is a Civil Engineer (NTUA) and holds an MBA and a DBA with a specialization in strategy.

Alexandra Choli is an ecosystem pioneer and early stage tech startup investor, currently active in the impact investing space through her latest venture, Epagon VC. She has 16 years of experience in the fields of operations, business development, and entrepreneurship, and is passionate about growing innovation-driven high-impact startups.

In 2011, she founded Metavallon, a model social enterprise that introduced the first startup incubator in Greece and spearheaded the formation of the startup ecosystem in the country. Four years later she launched Metavallon Ventures Limited, a micro-fund that introduced the first startup acceleration program in the country. In 2018, she co-founded and became a Partner at Metavallon VC, a €32mm venture capital firm investing in very early stage technology companies in Greece and Europe, with the European Investment Fund as an anchor investor in its inaugural fund. Prior to all ventures Metavallon, she worked in operations, management, and business development at several early-stage & small- to medium-sized businesses, both for-profit and non-profit, in Greece, UK, United States, Nicaragua and India.

In recognition of her pioneering work and entrepreneurial achievements the past decade, Alexandra has been featured in publications and university-taught case studies, was among Fortune’s 40 Under 40 in 2020, and was presented the ‘Entrepreneur of the Year’ Award by the British Council in 2018. She holds a Masters degree in Mechanical Engineering from University College London and a Master of Business Administration from New York University Stern School of Business, where she specialized in entrepreneurship, social innovation, and strategy.

Stephan Clambaneva is a product design & innovation leader with comprehensive global experience in areas of digital transformation, digital design and innovation management, and holistic closed looped systems thinking for end-to-end product development. He is well versed in providing cross-functional leadership and overseeing associated functions to include strategic planning and partnerships, experience design, product lifecycle management, large-scale project management, new business development, global marketing, team building, engineering, manufacturing operations and stakeholder engagement.

A thinker and a doer, Stephan has 20 years of experience working for tech giant IBM and global enterprise software leader Dassault Systemes leading product design and innovation projects for clients around the world. In addition, he is a strong communicator experienced in directing large teams and managing relationships with diverse clients, colleagues, and international stakeholders at all levels. He has also been accountable for securing and retaining high-level clients and Fortune 500 companies in numerous sectors, spearheading design and innovation services across multiple channels and executing global product development, research, and marketing strategies to facilitate sustainable business growth in highly competitive markets.

Further, Stephan is a multifaceted professional capable of leveraging extensive industry experience and executive management skills to drive the continued achievement of organizational objectives following the triple bottom line. He is known as a versatile contributor with experience in all product design and innovation management functions, has exceptional communication and leadership skills, and a continued commitment to implementing industry best practices fueled by an emphasis on sustainability. Besides being a global design and utility patent holder, Stephan has an active keynote and public speaking schedule around the world at conferences most recently at the 2021 Athens EcoFest, 2021 Boston Design Week, The IDSA Sustainability Deep Dive 20 and 21, Great Wave Athens Hub, the Sustainability Forum, Milan Salone, Denver Design Week, SxSW, NYCxDesign, DMI Design Leadership Conference, IDC, and the Innovation Summit, evangelizing on the strategic value of circular design principles, industrial design and innovation. He has published multiple papers on Creative Business Leadership, Augmented Reality, Mobility, Design Thinking, Innovation, Product Lifecycle Mgmt., ID, Eco-Design, Environmental Management Systems and Sustainability and more recently Design for Humanity. He has guest lectured at several universities and institutions on the topics of design leadership and sustainability most recently as part of the InnoMed -UP initiative for the National Technical University of Athens, SkillNet Ireland and the Savannah College of Art and Design.

Stephan has been an elected IDSA Leader since 2010 as a Member of the Board & Sections Director, Vice President for the Northeast District, Chair of IDSA for New York City. He was invited for a residency of the House of Beautiful Business. He was just nominated to join the Birthing of Giants Fellowship Program. He serves on the advisory board of numerous startups and on the executive committee for New York Design Week – NYCxDesign representing IDSA and is a permanent startup mentor of numerous global accelerators including the German Accelerator, GreekTech and the Orange Grove. He maintains residency in New York and Athens with his wife and son.

George Efstratiadis counts Accounting and MBA as his main educational areas, grown up in a family business environment, now running the 50 years family water services business, a company of 63 people present all over Greece.

The last 6 years, in an effort to diversify his business portfolio and as always interested in futuristic areas, he is actively participating in the Greek startup ecosystem as a mentor and an angel investor via LKM Peran his own consulting agency. George has invested and teamed up with Teastock to predict the short future trends of investing and trading products.

He has also offered his knowledge to startups and innovative SMEs as a volunteer mentor of Orange Grove in Patras. He believes in the combined and multi-business knowledge capabilities, especially where the main startup scope is a niche. George is generally against the ‘don’t give up’ doctrine – he is more in favour of ‘if you don’t earn money, you lose money’ way of doing consultancy and business.

Ignatios Fotiou received his Diploma of Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering from the Department of Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering of the University of Patras in 2005.

He is the man who invented SEATRAC, a patented device in the EU and USA which is the only worldwide solution for the autonomous access of people with mobility impairments to an aquatic environment. In 2012, he founded TOBEA Ltd, a spin-off company of University of Patras, which deals with innovative solutions and products for the improvement of the quality of life for people with disabilities, being a leading company in this field in Greece.

His business activity extends beyond TOBEA Ltd as well as in other sectors where he is always involved in innovation. At the same time, he is preparing his PhD thesis on composite materials in the Department of Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering of the University of Patras, through which he has participated in a number of research projects.

Holding the position of “Digital Entrepreneurship and Technological Innovation” at the department of Applied informatics at the University of Macedonia in Thessaloniki, Greece, I am teaching in the area of innovation and entrepreneurship, e-business and development of new products and services.

I also currently teach at International Hellenic University and University of the Aegean related topics and also collaborate with a number of other Academic Institutes in the areas of innovation and entrepreneurship. My research has been published in international peer-reviewed journals and conferences and I have participated in research consortia for more than 15 International and National research projects, including research projects in Developing countries.

I teach because I am passionate about entrepreneurship, innovation and development of new ventures. I also have been a serial entrepreneur developing a number of Business ventures mainly related to provision of Digital, innovative services, others resulting in success and others in teaching me valuable lessons. My background is widespread and is combining studies and experience ranging from crafting and aligning a corporate strategy and responding to competition with innovative actions to handling and rearranging business operations and filling in accounting and financial information to analyzing pricing decisions. This diversity has allowed me to obtain a broader view in developing new business ventures ranging from evaluation of the business proposition to financial projections analysis. To this end I am happy to assist new entrepreneurs of any age that pursuit their dreams.

I am doing so through various Incubator programs such as Orange Grove, Ace-In, EkinisiLab and by personal coaching and innovation competitions such as e-nnovation and iBank. I have also been extensively engaged with business advisory, trying to assist established firms with limited organizational capabilities to evolve to viable, competitive players in their markets and organize their internal resources in a more efficient way. I have also been a member of the European Space Agency (ESA) Technology Transfer initiative team.

I believe that entrepreneurship is very important and can significantly advance economic prosperity and improvement of the national level of innovation through the utilization of ICT and smart ways to approach current customer pains worldwide.

Serving as the CEO of HVA International, a Dutch agricultural project development company, Miltiadis has an extensive background in finance, cost engineering and project management. His expertise is currently focused on large scale agricultural projects for PEVC funds worldwide.

Miltiadis founded CostWise in 2008, a company that tailored custom-made cost models and conducted a wide array of due diligence assignments. He simultaneously served as consultant on a number of large scale infrastructural projects in Latin America, Africa and South-East Asia, while, from his position as COO of International Advisers, he led negotiations regarding trade credit insurance contracts. In the public sector, Miltiadis has served as special advisor to the President and CEO of the Transport For Athens Organization with 8,500 employees.

During his time on this post he led a significant restructuring and introduced several strategic initiatives. Miltiadis is a member of the Development Finance Forum (DFF) of the World Bank and has collaborated on the design of large projects in developing countries. In his spare time, Miltiadis is a media commentator on macroeconomic topics and has authored articles in the international press.

He also mentors startups and was one of the drivers initiating and establishing the incubator Orange Grove, a Dutch-Greek initiative. He is also an active promoter of the world’s first SDG House in Amsterdam which provides a unique forum for sustainable businesses seeking a global reach.

Miltiadis holds a bachelor’s degree from Hogeschool Utrecht and an MBA from Nottingham Trent University/AGSM. He is fluent in English, Dutch, and Greek and has a working knowledge of Spanish and French

Dimitris Karavasilis is the founder and the CEO of the DK Consultants firm, which operates in the field of Business Consulting specializing in the areas of International Marketing and Strategic Development of International Activity. He has studied Business Administration and International Marketing at UNIVERSITY OF SHEFFIELD. He has attended dozens of specialized seminars internationally in marketing, exports and sales. He is a member of the Administrative Committee and the Board of Directors of the Greek International Business Association (SEVE). He participates in the core team of Dutch experts of the Task Force for the structural reform of the State towards a single National Export Strategy; he is also a member of the Hellenic Institute of Marketing and active member of International Organizations. Prior to the foundation of the Business Consulting firm «DK Consultants» he had been occupied as a senior and executive in industrial and commercial enterprises in Greece and abroad (SATO, Toshiba, Sunair, Premierotel, Pointgroup, Axon Inc., DB group). Since 1999 he has supported significant Greek and foreign firms by providing them with consulting services, and by designing and applying internationally orientated marketing and sales strategies.

“As an adolescent person growing up in challenging circumstances, it was more than often I was reminded of what I am incapable of doing or the “you can’t do that” or “that will never work”.

Always the optimist and of the “why not” mentality, my resoluteness to effect the indispensable change to make things transpire is my disruptive innovation to prosper. I have worn many hats in my vocation, sales and marketing, packaging and product development, finance and legal, branding and sourcing, negotiator and strategist. As a result I have a unique skill set to manage multi-disciplinary projects and to navigate

intricate challenges.

With the perpetuated proliferation of globalization, I believe that life experience through travel and the openness to learn, the endeavor to understand other cultures and engage is one of the most consequential factors providing insights into emerging business ideas and exponential growth. I enjoy making new professional and social acquaintances; it’s how we learn from one another and how we grow. Reach out if you want

to talk business, coffee or culinary.

Skill Set: disruptive innovation and solutions, operation management, consumer packaged goods, branding, sales and marketing, flexibility, multi-tasking, collaboration and team building, strategist, legal and finance, international business.”

Online marketing professional and Google AdWords Certified professional since 2007, focused on maximizing online marketing potential for every web project.

I always work closely with project owners by setting specific KPI and focusing on maximising the ROI through inbound marketing. I manage to achieve my goals and maximising ROI by:

1) setting clear expectation on the goals, creating marketing plan & budgeting resources

2) selecting the appropriate KPI in order to monitor progress

3) communicate carefully crafted, attention-getting marketing messages

4) constantly evaluating the best performing channels that deliver the vast majority of targeted traffic at the lowest possible cost.

I have implemented more than 120 online marketing projects including some of the biggest Google AdWords and SEO projects in Greece with success, helping existing and new web projects achieve their goals with efficiency. Since 2010 I managed more than 20 international online marketing projects.

Specialties:

– Marketing Strategy

– Marketing Communications

– Budgeting

– E-commerce marketing

– Hotel & hospitality online marketing

– Landing Page Optimization

– Conversion Optimization

– Google Analytics Consulting

Online channels that I have been using for many years in order to optimize effectiveness:

– Search Engine Optimization (Keyword Research, Onsite optimization, Copywriting, Link Building, Training)

– Google AdWords (Set Up – Manage & Optimize: Search Ads, Display Ads, YouTube Ads, Interaction Ads)

– Facebook Advertising

– Content Marketing (Blog posts, YouTube Videos)

– Conversion Optimization

– Landing Page Optimization

– Social Media

– Email Marketing

Throughout my career I have created Online Marketing teams out of people with small or no experience experience in Online & Digital Marketing that through effective training and guidance grew to become online marketing professionals themselves.

George Likourezos is a partner and patent attorney at the intellectual property law firm of Carter, DeLuca & Farrell LLP. George graduated from Touro University Law Center and obtained a degree in electrical engineering from NYU Tandon School of Engineering. He has a master’s degree in Operations Management also from NYU Tandon School of Engineering. He represent many universities, research institutions, and multinational corporations, as well as startups, scaleups and SMEs, in protecting their intellectual property in technical areas such as aerospace and defense, semiconductors, robotics, AI and mobile applications, communications, mobility and transportation, IoT and sensors, machine vision, medical devices, and many other areas. George is admitted to practice before the United States Patent and Trademark Office and has established relationships with international law firms to protect his client’s technologies in every patent jurisdiction. He enjoys mentoring emerging technology startups and university spinoffs based in the USA and worldwide on topics such as the patent process, strategic patent portfolio development, freedom to operate, trademark and brand protection, and IP management. He is also a lecturer at the IP Business Academy of the Center for International Intellectual Property Studies at the University of Strasburg, and the Co-chair of the Startups Committee of the International Institute for IP Management (I3PM). George is a regular presenter and writer on intellectual property topics.

Founder of Atlantis Consulting S.A., a company based in Thessaloniki, Greece with branch offices in Athens and Larisa and subsidiaries in Heraklion, Lamia, Agrinio, Founder of Atlantis Engineering S.A., Founder of Atlantis Cyprus Ltd – an environmental company, Co-founder of Hellenic Association of Mobile Applications Companies (HAMAC), Facilitator of Hellenic Mobile Cluster, Founder and Manager of Adrion Business Angels

Network, Principle Consultant of Technopolis Artificial Intelligence (AI) Cluster, Evaluator of SME Instrument Phase II, Head of the Evaluation and Management Programme of funding thousands of SMEs from Piraeus Bank through the Framework Programme of Support Greece. An honorary member in the HAMAC Association for high contribution in establishing the Hellenic Mobile Cluster and implementation of the HAMAC vision.

Throughout his 30 years of consulting experience, he has worked with a large portfolio of HiTech/IT Startups and Industrial SMEs among others Upstream, Compucon, Unisoft, Fasmetrics, Computer Logic, Globo, Brite Hellas, MLS, Wadja, Cosmos Holding, Haitoglou Bros S.A., KRI-KRI S.A., DORAL SA, Hatzopoulos S.A., Velti S.A., Logismos S.A., K &N Efthimiadis, Viva S.A. et al along with strong working relationships with innovation policy makers internationally. In his career with Atlantis Consulting he has worked with thousands of mainly industrial SMEs providing more than 1 billion euros in funding through EU and National subsidy programs.

He has served as member of the Board of Directors of Wadja Ltd and he has been elected as General Secretary in the Greek Diving Center Association. He holds a MSc degree in Technical Chain and Industrial Strategy from the University of Manchester and a Civil Engineer Diploma with specialization in Project Management. He has been coordinator among many other EU funded projects, Euromanagement I and II, Gate2Start, MOBIP and EMMINVEST projects focusing in Access to Finance as well as participated in several relevant EU projects such as GraspInno, SmartInno et.al.

He has initiated the pre-incubation concept, launched and managed the 40-day clinic and Stage II Acceleration Programmes, the only 4 International Venture Capital Events in Greece, several Venture Capital Events in European cities like London, Barcelona, Milan, et al, a few Pan-European Acceleration Programmes and 5 Business Angels Forums in Greece. Furthermore, he has designed the initiation of programmes such as E-tender, Jobical, E-consulting and Congress Help. He has been placed as Head of big Impact Assessment Studies of EU R&D policies in Europe and in Greece as well as his role as coach and mentor to many innovation competition and acceleration programmes has been catalytic. He is extremely known for his ethos, hard work and excellent managerial capabilities.

Despite his main line of business activities, he hasn’t stopped in pursuing his passion for the underwater cultural heritage sector, thus for the last 15 years – being himself an experienced and certified PADI Diving Instructor – he has been engaged in the implementation of several national and European Projects, focusing in the protection and promotion of underwater cultural heritage (i.e. Bluemed, Lab4Dive, ScienceDiver, MeDryDive, Magna, UCRCA, etc) and has been author and co- author of a series of relevant papers and abstracts. Angelos is currently in the process of applying for a PhD at the Department of History, Archeology and Social Anthropology at the University of Thessaly.

Marketing expert and Innovation catalyst, with focus on enabling people and facilitating businesses transform, discover and exploit superior value. Passionate about challenging the status quo, discovering new paths and walking in unknown territories.

Katerina has over 20 years of experience in business, marketing and communications, having held senior marketing and trade positions (Marketing Director, Global Category, Trade Marketing Manager) in large multinational companies. Currently she is working as a consultant focusing on areas like strategic planning, innovation, business & marketing, and as a business trainer/facilitator working with leading companies in Greece.

Her work has been awarded and received the Marketing Excellence Award from the Hellenic Institute of Marketing and the Grand Award for product innovation, as well as the HR Award and HR Excellence Award for Best Talent Development program.

She is an elected member of the Executive Committee of the Hellenic Institute of Marketing, where she has also been appointed General Secretary, and is leading activities that promote marketing and innovation in Greece.

She has studied marketing at the American College of Greece, Deree College and holds a postgraduate degree (MBA) from Boston University, focusing in marketing and strategic planning.

Born on May of 1986 in Patras, Yiannis Nikolopoulos finished school with remarkable grades and got into the dept. of Electrical & Computer Engineering. Only 3 years later, he co-founded his own company which builds & runs solar parks ever since, along with a friend from the dept. of Mechanical Engineering & Aeronautics. At the same time he was volunteering as a Red Cross Samaritan in between classes and his first job at the National Telecommunications Organisation.

In Oct. 2009, his sister’s car accident forced him to develop a most flexible problem-solving approach. He kept running the solar parks and pursuing his personal projects, while neglecting college due to the tight schedule of her medical treatment. This experience helped him sharpen his emotional intelligence and taught him to be productive under very stressful circumstances, while keeping calm and happy.

In Oct. 2012 Yiannis co-founded Clio Muse PC: what started as a 3-people tour guide app startup, evolved to a 20 full-time employees company which runs a Software as a Service platform for anyone to publish and resell their digital self-guided tours.

Since launching, Clio Muse has successfully hosted and curated over 100 tours in Greece, Italy, Austria and the US while partnering with the Athens International Airport, Athens Biennale, Art-Athina, Municipality of Athens, American School of Classical Studies, Embassies (Netherlands and Germany) and the National Bank of Greece. They have been awarded over 10 times globally for the re-use of cultural content and its business model and mentioned in major newspapers like USA Today and the New York Times. In 2019, they managed to grow 10 times and serve 50K travelers, while getting 5-star reviews on GetYourGuide, TripAdvisor, Expedia, etc.

Yiannis is the proud CTO in Clio Muse PC, contributed as a founding member to the creation of Orange Grove Patras an dis currently a BoD member of Orange Grove.

Faye has followed a multidisciplinary career, discovering and developing her potential along the way. This has offered her a rich diverse experience in various fields.

She believes to be a generalist by design (a “homo universalis”), but whenever she dedicates herself to a mission, she focuses to acquire in-depth knowledge and experience and to offer high-quality specialized services.

Currently she is devoting herself in capacity building for science-based ventures through Sci-2-Biz studio, which is focused in the science-to-business process. Furthermore, she designes and organizes learning & development (L&D) programs for AELIA-lab, an organization that she co-founded and managed, which initially started as a non profit and recently evolved into an L & D agency. (Sci-2-Biz studio is an initiative of AELIA-lab).

Formerly, she had an intensive career path, which passed through consulting firms, law firms, public policy and finally research organizations. She also attempted her own consulting firm venture. Her path led her to technology transfer and innovation development in the R&D ecosystem.

In parallel she always dedicated time to the mission of AELIA Lab, designing and organizing L&D activities for people of diverse backgrounds.

Poly is a Director Business Programs | Digital Transformation Leader at Microsoft. Her role is to power, protect, and enable CEE’s digital transformation of business and employee experiences, while serving as a market advocate through leadership engagements inside and outside the company.

In the past, Poly was working at OTE Group and she was responsible for Process Improvement Division. The role of the division was to provide process simplification and operational transformation, for OTE Group companies and ICT customers. In addition to this role at OTE Group, Poly was also leading the IT Innovation Center which aim was to deliver Innovation to OTE Group customers and employees, in order to improve people’s lives and enhance the technological brand of the company.

Before that, Poly has worked in consulting with PricewaterhouseCoopers Greece and IBM Global Services UK, for engagements in service areas such as organisation & operations, process improvement and IT strategy.

Has more than 20 years’ experience in Process Management and Operational Transformation.

As a marketing strategist, brand builder and storyteller Melina helps entrepreneurs, rising leaders and businesses connect and align with the power of their why and translate it into a meaningful brand story and focused digital marketing strategy. Her mission is to support you in your journey to communicate, share and spread your reason for being with the world in a way that resonates deeply, and authentically with the people that can benefit from your products & services the most.

Melina brings a unique perspective that is awareness and mindset based and am also passionate about helping individuals and teams thrive by helping them tapping into flow states that unlock their inner genius using awareness based practices, mindfulness, NLP, and her background in health coaching.

She has spent the last decade leading entrepreneurs, marketing teams and projects for a wide range of companies and industries around the world including: health/wellness, personal development, technology, digital media, music/art, hospitality/tourism, urban planning and fashion. She currently runs her own branding consultancy and digital marketing agency, Spark Your Brand.

Melina holds an Economics degree from Duke University and is also an MIT Sloan MBA alum, with a Master’s in Management Studies from The Lisbon MBA. She brings a unique perspective that is awareness and mindset based through the use of NLP, design thinking, integrative health coaching and flow state practices.

Dr. Chris Sotiropoulos has extensive expertise in global commercialisation of innovative education, healthcare and technology products and services. He serves as Co-Founder and CEO of Global Opportunities Commercialisation, Managing Director of Mainstage Hub and Director of APAC Health, both private companies that deliver entrepreneurship, commercialisation advisory services and their own products to national and international clients.

He is an internationally speaker on such issues faced by many industries, diverse forums and nations, including Afghanistan (for climate change), Nigeria (for IT clusters), India (for Digital education, Artificial Intelligence for crop nutrition and start-up mindset), Australia (for artificial intelligence and emotional intelligence), Somalia (peacebuilding training of parliamentarians and tribes), UK for capacity building and mindset change, Philippines (for education innovations) and South Korea (for health innovations).

In the healthcare sector, he has introduced medicines for the treatment of sleep disorders, rare diseases and completed licensing deals worth over USD $300m.

He is also a practising Lawyer, focussing on International Trade and Commercial Law transactions, assisting clients to quickly grow their business, develop strategy and implement corporate restructure for global expansion in US, Europe, Africa and Asia. His knowledge of commercial practices and business mindsets across disparate markets enables more pragmatic advice, drafting and negotiations, reducing grievances due to cultural misalignment.

He has taught at university entrepreneurship and MBA programs in the field of innovation, corporate strategy and venture development. He is a frequent international speaker, speaking at forums in Europe, USA, India, Africa, Asia and Australia on themes including education models for emerging nations, youth and women empowerment and its role in nation capability development.

He serves on private and public governing boards and charities in several countries. He is also a mentor to executives in the US and Europe and a mentor advisor for start up incubators in India, Greece and an Australian university.

He holds a PhD in Molecular Microbiology, a Law Degree from Australian universities and completed Executive Training in Leadership and Strategy in Pharmaceuticals and Biotech Executive Training from the Harvard Business School.

Theodore Tollis is the Executive Director of Employment Solutions Division of ICAP Group since March 2008 after the buyout of the business. In parallel, he is an appointed Director of ICAP Employment Solutions Romania Srl and ICAP Cyprus.

Theodore has more than 27 years professional experience mostly in consulting (general business, change management, IT and HR). Except Greece, he has worked for several years in various countries in Europe and various locations in USA. During his professional career, he has worked in international companies in IT projects, redesign processes, getting involved with change management and human resources in the USA and Europe. Have been directly involved in several (20) US and European SAP R/3, SAP HR, CRM, SCM and EAI tool implementations and e-commerce projects working as a team lead, project lead and project manager/director getting valuable hands-on experience.

Theodore has served for two years as Director of Information Technology Europe in a large specialty chemical company Crompton Corp (now Chemtura) based in London. Responsible for the European SAP roll out in various locations and the support and upgrade of existing SAP locations. Direct a team of some 50 individuals across Europe in supporting head office, local manufacturing plants (8), sales offices and their management with up-to-date and relevant data with which the company can run its operations together with hardware and software support as required. The user community included 1000 individuals.

In the last 15 years, after his return to Greece, Theodore served as a General Manager at a group company of National Bank of Greece, as Chairman and CEO of two major public hospitals, Laiko and KAT. Currently he is the Executive Director Director of ICAP Employment Solutions, which employs 2,200 staff at its customer’s premises.

Theodore has studied Mathematics and Computer Science in the U.S. Holds two M.S. Degrees from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (Mathematics) and the University of Texas at Dallas (Computer Science) and a Ph.D. in Mathematics/Theoretical Computer Science. Holds a continuing education certificate in Business Administration and Technology from Harvard University and is a member of the Academy of Sciences of New York.

Dr. Ioannis Tomkos is currently Professor of Optical Communications at the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering of the University of Patras, Greece and his research is focusing on 5G mobile networks and datacenter networks. In the past he held various academic and managerial positions, of increasing responsibility, at companies and academic institutions around the world (e.g. USA, Spain, France).

Over the past 20 years, he has managed teams that participated in industry R&D projects and in a record number of EU-funded industry-academia collaborative projects (over 25 in total; 14 just in FP7) with a consortium-wide leading role (including being Technical Manager of 10 major projects with a total budget of over 50M€). For his research group, he has raised about 9.5M€ in funding, all as Principal Investigator (PI) of his institution; making him one of the top performers within EU in terms of attraction of funding. His direct reports included over 100 people, while the EU project consortia that he has coordinated (i.e. 10, among the 25 for which he served as PI) included multi- national teams of more than 20-40 scientists/engineers.

His research activities resulted in over 650 co-authored scientific archival articles, with over 410 entries at IEEEXplore (making him one of the most highly published authors at IEEE journals/proceedings). His published work has received over 10.500 citations (h-factor=49). He is included in the “Top H-Index” list of scientists working in the fields of “Computer Science and Electronics” (https://lnkd.in/gYwzYY4) & has received about 110.000 reads at ResearchGate (therefore being one of the most published and cited Greek authors in the field of electrical engineering and among the top worldwide on core/access/datacenter networks). For his scientific achievements and as a recognition of the broad impact of his work, he is among the few researchers in the world who have been elected as Fellows of 3 different professional societies; namely the Institute of Engineering and Technology-IET (2010), the Optical Society of America-OSA (2012) and the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers-IEEE (2018).

Prof. Tomkos has been serving as advisor for major companies and governmental organizations and executives, assisting them in their technology strategy and intellectual property development efforts, as well as in business planning and activities.

Maria Vytinidou, Chemist-Fashion Designer-Entrepreneur, distinguished by VOGUE ITALIA for her entrepreneurship, started her career as a Chemist & Sales executive at J&J multinational company.

After working there for 18 years, she quitted her job and became the Founder & CEO of <<AthensFashionClub>> Group of Fashion, that involves her Fashion Brand <<Μaria Vytinidou Conscious Design Brand>> and also <<AthensFashionClub>> Fashion School and the 1rst Athens Fashion Business Incubator <<The Fashion Gate>>.

She is a graduate of the Chemistry department of University of Crete and also a graduate of Central St Martin’s College of Arts & Design and London College of Fashion.

In 2013 she established her company as one of the best 20 High Fashion Technology companies in the world at the global Contest Startupbootcamp High Tech XL in Eindhoven of Holland, while 2 years later in 2015 the ‘Premiere Vision Paris’ featured her as one of the most Innovative Fashion Designers in Wearable Technology in Europe.

In 2020, Maria Vytinidou, alumni of Orange Grove, created the ‘Co-Incubation’ programme in collaboration with the Dutch Embassy in Athens focusing on Sustainable fashion and offering to the participants the potential to cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset in order to build a successful fashion brand.

Maria Biquet is an experienced multilingual Business Consultant and Executive Coach with vast experience from diverse business fields. She has worked with senior executives from different countries in the private sector, the public sector and international NGO’s. In the last 20 years she has worked for multinational companies in strategic marketing positions and led startup projects for setting up new companies. She brings knowledge of diverse business sectors such as Telecommunications, Automotive, Retail Financing, Insurance, Banking and Consulting.

Maria has long experience in Strategic Marketing and in establishing companies in new markets. Since 2010 she has worked as Consultant focusing on introducing innovative services to the market and on guiding people in developing new skills necessary for highly complex environments.

Since 2009 Maria specializes in Executive Coaching for individual development of Executives and in Leadership development projects for companies aiming at increasing leadership energy which leads to improved people efficiency and company results.

Maria holds an MBA-International Marketing from Sunderland University – UK, a BA in Literature and Linguistics from the University of Athens – GR and a Diploma in Coaching from the Coaching Institute – UK, and has an advanced certification as neuro-coach by NBG in the USA and a Certified Master Coach by the CAC (Centre for Advanced Coaching) in the USA. For more than 15 years she has studied various methodologies for self development and change including Systemic approach, Appreciative Inquiry Approach, NLP and mindfulness techniques.

A certified professional Performance & Development Coach, committed to helping people, businesses, and teams scale-up. A graduate of an ICF Accredited Academy of Coaching with a people-centered approach and an inner drive for growth and improvement.

Currently collaborating with Envolve, Orange Grove, WoT, Prisma Consulting, Found.ation, and EIT Digital, as a Startup Coach on various projects with leading incubators, accelerators, and hackathons in Greece and abroad. Has proudly coached and mentored many award-winning teams.

She has coaching experience with entrepreneurs and businesses ranging from small startups to well-established enterprises. As a Coach, she is focusing on productivity and development, owner mindset, self-optimization and presentation, adaptability, conflict management, and team dynamics.

As a coach, she is also working with undergraduate and post-graduate students as well as Ph.D. candidates from around the globe for productivity, self-presentation, success mindset, time & energy management, in order to create clarity and focus on their end goals.

Additionally, she sits on the Advisory Board of the We Go Zero Company, headquartered in Amsterdam.

She has co-founded a Business Coaching Company headquartered in The Netherlands, operating in 3 Hubs, and a Leadership Skills Academy for Startups in Greece.

Started her career as a licensed Educator/Trainer for Special Education Institutions, working in Special Education Institutions and NGOs on multiple long-term projects for the relief of people in times of crisis and emergency situations.

Penelope Dimitrakopoulou is an Executive and Team Coach certified by the International Coaching Federation (ICF Global). She has accredited Diplomas in Personal and Executive Coaching, as well as Team and Leadership Coaching. She has a Bachelor degree in Psychology (BA) from Bath University and a master’s degree in New Media Studies (MA) from the University of Bristol. Penelope has been working as an International Sales Representative (marketing, promotion, sales), for over 15 years. Since 2015, she has been working as an Executive and Team coach, and is now specialized in Leadership Coaching for companies, start-ups and NGOs. She also hosts corporate seminars and webinars covering a wide range of subjects for professional development. Her work focuses on creating value through individual empowerment, development of leadership and entrepreneurial skills in order to attain desired goals. Her high proficiency of multiple languages (Greek, French, English), allows her to work with companies and executives on a multinational level.

Eleni has been offering coaching and corporate training services to arge medium and small companies for a number of years and specialises in a combination of team workshops and personal coaching. She has helped varous teams as well as individuals in a number of situations, including Change, Conflict, Team Bonding and Leadership.

Hecata is offering its services to companies and individuals across Europe and the Middle East, with face-to-face, Skype and telephone sessions.

Eleni has a diversified knowledge of corporate, organisational and management issues, due to her past involvement with large multinationals. This is paramount when coaching top executives whether is for improving their interpersonal influence, or for reinforcing their team’s communication, vision/mission alignment and effectiveness.

In the past 12 years, that Eleni has been practicing, she has coached over 50 executives of different industries, backgrounds and cultures. She is known for her insightful recognition of the real issues that need to b addressed in each case.

Eleni has held a broad spectrum of positions in international corporations, including over 15 years in IBM Europe, where her main role was Marketing Director EMEA. She also held strategic positions in Accenture France, Cable and Wireless UK, UNESCO etc. Her coaching company clients include Nexans, Netstudio, the Netherlands Embassy in Athens and individuals working for a variety of market sectors.

She also offers pro-bono coaching and mentoring to start-ups and charities and she is a board member of the charity organisation Filotis and a founding member of KEMEL (Centre of Greek Volunteer top Managers).
